findings.title: One Person can verify one more time at each new contract redeployment
findings.description: A vulnerability exists where one person can verify one more time at each new contract redeployment in SybilGovID.sol.

findings.title: Use call() instead of transfer to transfer ETH
findings.description: The contract uses transfer() to send ETH, which only allows 2300 gas and might fail if the recipient needs more gas. It's recommended to use call() instead.

findings.title: Using address.transfer to transfer Ether is not suggested
findings.description: The function `collectPayments` uses `address.transfer` to transfer ether to the contract owner, which may cause issues due to increased gas costs after Ethereum's Istanbul upgrade and potential insufficient gas for proxy contracts. It is recommended to use Openzeppelin's `safeTransfer` or `call()` instead.

findings.title: Remove unnecessary import
findings.description: The contract Roots.sol imports hardhat/console.sol which is not used

findings.title: Lack of proper notification for important state changes
findings.description: The contract PaidProof.sol lacks proper notification for important state changes in functions setPrice(), revokeIssuers(), and allowIssuers(). This is critical as it affects off-chain systems that monitor the contract.
